required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Meeting Protein Targets in Critically Ill Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Meeting Protein Targets in Critically Ill Patients: A Retrospective Analysis

brief_summary.textblock: This is a retrospective study of protein and energy intake in enterally fed critically ill adult patients before and after the introduction of a very high protein enteral nutrition formula in a single center medical/surgical ICU.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily up to 7 days of ICU stay
primary_outcome.description: Daily total protein intake and percent prescribed protein needs met during first week of ICU admission.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily up to 7 days of ICU stay
secondary_outcome.description: Total calories aggregate from all sources

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily up to 7 days of ICU stay
secondary_outcome.description: Total volume consumed and weight will be used to measure kcal/kg

secondary_outcome.measure: Daily caloric intake from enteral nutrition
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily up to 7 days of ICU stay
secondary_outcome.description: Daily caloric intake from enteral nutrition, and medications (i.e. Propofol)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of prescribed calorie needs met
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily up to 7 days of ICU stay
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of prescribed calorie needs met

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily up to 7 days of ICU stay
secondary_outcome.description: Feeding interruptions; and reason for interruption, if recorded in electronic medical record/nursing flow sheets

secondary_outcome.measure: Use of inotropes/vasopressors (highest daily dose prescribed)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily up to 7 days of ICU stay
secondary_outcome.description: Use of inotropes/vasopressors will be documented as a Yes/No.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily up to 7 days of ICU stay
secondary_outcome.description: Feeding tolerance as recorded by clinicians in electronic medical record/nursing flow sheets [gastrointestinal side effects observed and documented: vomiting, elevated Gastric Residual Volumes (>200 mL), aspiration, pneumonia, diarrhea (Bristol stool chart definition and ≥ 3 liquid stools/day)]

arm_group.description: 20 enterally fed critically ill adult patients prior to the introduction of a very high protein enteral nutrition formula [2015].
20 enterally fed critically ill adult patients post the introduction of a very high protein enteral nutrition formula [2016].

study_pop.textblock: Adult medical/surgical ICU patients that received enteral nutrition with or without a very high protein enteral nutrition formula.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients ≥ 18 years of age, mechanically ventilated
- Received enteral nutrition for a minimum of five days during the first week of ICU admission
Exclusion Criteria:
- Received parenteral nutrition during first week of ICU admission
- Acute renal failure not dialyzed
- Hepatic encephalopathy grade 3 or 4
- Intentional underfeeding/trophic feeding - including refeeding syndrome
